instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_G3H: What is 3V3_G3H? This is one of the first power rails that must turn on for Macbooks that use USB-C for charging. This power rail powers the CD3215 chip that controls the USB-C charger, speaks to the USB-C charger, and requests 20 volts up from the default 5 volts that the USB-C charger puts out when initially connected to an unknown device. .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No booting up but CPU/GPU warm with fan spinning.
threads.message:
I have this board, customer said it wasn't getting image to the display but did get image on external display. Once i started working on it, i noticed there was no usb-c activity on any of the port, which also meant no external display image. Started probing and noticed L7410 and L7421 (<SIGNAL>PPVCCGT_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>) were reading 0v. 

Signals to <CHIP>U7410</CHIP>/<CHIP>U7420</CHIP>
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> - 5v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_HS_CPU</SIGNAL> - 12.6
<SIGNAL>CPUGT_FCCM</SIGNAL> - 0.015
<SIGNAL>CPUGT_PWM1</SIGNAL> - 2.57
<SIGNAL>CPUGT_PWM2</SIGNAL> - 2.58

current pull by the board swings inconsistently between 1.20 and .91A

Any suggestions?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No booting up but CPU/GPU warm with fan spinning.
threads.message:
VCCGT refers to iGPU and doesn't come on when board boots.

USB-C ports switch to 20V?
<SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No booting up but CPU/GPU warm with fan spinning.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No booting up but CPU/GPU warm with fan spinning.
threads.message:
Do you get <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>?
If yes, check for USB activity and external video?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No booting up but CPU/GPU warm with fan spinning.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> - 1.08
No usb activity or external video.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No booting up but CPU/GPU warm with fan spinning.
threads.message:
Looks like board doesn't really boot.
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> should change in few steps, untill 0.6V aprox.
Possibly bad CPU.
Try known good BIOS, just in case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No booting up but CPU/GPU warm with fan spinning.
threads.message: Tried good bios with same issue, and <SIGNAL>PPVCC_SO_CPU</SIGNAL> never steps down.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No booting up but CPU/GPU warm with fan spinning.
threads.message: Ask the client how he lost internal image first.
